headline: Leftover Ham -n- Potato Casserole
description: This easy, cheesy ham and potato casserole is the perfect choice for a post-holiday breakfast or an easy weeknight dinner.

video.description: This easy, cheesy ham and potato casserole uses up leftover Christmas or Easter ham! It's perfect for a post-holiday breakfast or an easy weeknight dinner.
video.name: How to Make Leftover Ham-n-Potato Casserole

name: Leftover Ham -n- Potato Casserole
recipeIngredient: 6 small potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
0.667 pound leftover cooked ham, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 1 1/2-quart baking dish.

When the potatoes are almost finished, melt 3 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add ham and onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat.
Drain potatoes; add to the ham mixture and stir to combine. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.
Melt remaining 4 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and stir until the mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes.

Gradually whisk milk into the flour mixture; season with salt and black pepper. Continue cooking and stirring until thickened, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in Cheddar cheese until melted.
Pour cheese sauce over ham and potatoes. Sprinkle bread crumbs over top.
Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbly and browned, 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I thought this was really good. Had a nice flavor and will definitely make again.
I added Gruyère cheese with the cheddar and a little tarragon . No bread crumbs since I’m gluten intolerant. This was sooo good! Ty

I wasn't sure how much I would like this as I'm not a big fan of dishes made with leftover ham, but I loved it, as did my finicky husband. Thank you. I do have one complaint though, your prep time is WAY off. Peeling and cutting up potatoes into half inch squares, finely cutting up an onion, cutting ham into half inch squares, not to mention the cooking of the potatoes, onion etc. The preparation of the cheese sauce before putting everything into a casserole dish. All that is prep time before baking. It takes much, much longer than 15 minutes.

This is such an easy and delicious week night meal. I have made it twice now and cut the recipe in half because it's just my husband and me. Also I've used left over deli ham off the bone and I think I like that better than chunks of ham. Husband didn't like the bread crumbs on top though. Thanks for the recipe!

I followed the recipe but did make it in a bit different order to allow for the one pot idea. I used my dutch oven - cooked the onions up in the butter then added 3 cups of chicken stock (vs. milk) and then the ham and cubed potatoes. Once the potatoes were cooked - drained reserving the 1 1/2 c of the broth - added the flour to thicken sauce and then the cheese. Put potatoes and ham back into the dutch oven - covered with the sauce and baked according to the recipe. Fantastic.
With the exception of cheating and using frozen potato cubes that were thawed I followed the recipe to a T. It was fantastic. 2 of us darned near finished the whole thing in one sitting.
Delicious and had leftovers. If I had Campbell's cherse soup it probably would have worked and been quicker.

It taste just like my grandma's ham and potatoes! We loved it! The only thing I did differently is add just a pinch of salt and dash of pepper in the flour and butter before adding milk. Great recipe! Thank you!

NOT a one-pot meal. Four separate pots are needed: 1) boil potatoes 2) sautee 3) make cheese sauce 4) bake in 9x9 dish. More labor-intensive than it seems. Flavor was a bit heavy (lots of butter) yet a little basic. Needs some additional spices, perhaps paprika? Also, I would broil for the last 5 minutes in the oven to brown the breakcrumbs a bit.

Everyone loved it!! Didn't do exact measurements, but still turned out great! I used Colby jack cheese and seasoned salt ( what I had on hand). I didn't use bread crumbs. Had to cook a little longer to brown on top. I definitely recommend this, even had leftovers.

I'm not a huge fan of ham, but I loved this! I didn't have bread crumbs, but I did have cheese and garlic croutons, so that's what I put on top. I'm wondering if this dish could be made ahead, frozen, and successfully baked at a later date?
Came out great! The family loved it.
I made this as written and it was a hit with my family, aged 4 to 71. It's refreshing to find a casserole that does not call for canned soup.
This was delicious. Family enjoyed as well. Made it as directed, with the exception of substituting crushed croutons for breadcrumbs , and it came out perfectly.

I had less than a full cup of milk but i didn’t have time to run to the store so i just continued with the recipe. I messed up and made the “cheese sauce” first, but i just took it off the heat while doing the onions and ham. It was a very thick sauce to “pour” over the casserole but i “placed” it gently over the casserole and baked it. I laughed while serving it to my family thinking we would have to run out for a pizza but it tasted really good! They liked it! I can’t wait to try it again with enough milk!
I added broccoli along with the ham and potatoes..added more cheese..used crushed Ritz crackers instead of bread crumbs.. delicious
Tasty vintage style recipe. I added 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, and a bag of chopped broccoli. Because ham already has a lot of salt, I did not add any additional salt.
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
Very good added a change used tex mex cheese and added carrots cook the carrots like the potatoes and used seasoned bread crumbs for the top.
This was delicious! I made it according to directions. My husband suggested that I add some peas next time. It will be awesome!
Loved it, I added corn to it and it was so good.

Fantastic! We love it. Cut potatoes small and boiled 15 minutes instead of 20. I added salt and pepper while warming potatoes and ham together and sprinkled cheddar and parsley on top of breadcrumbs to finish, but otherwise did not change a thing. A keeper!
The whole family loved it I grated Califlour over it instead of breadcrumbs it was lovely thanks for the recipe ??
I made it with no changes. I'll make it again sometime.
My husband loves this casserole. It is a great way to use up left over ham.
My whole family loved it, including my husband and he's not big on ham.
Make sure to cut up potatoes into bite sizes. Add more ham than called for in the recipie. Also look to add crunch onion rings
Quite good. Husband really liked it
Delicious cheese sauce! I only had shredded taco cheese mix so used that and added a layer of fresh broccoli. I cooked potatoes in a steam bag in the microwave. Loved it!
I didn't change anything.

I made a couple changes. I used about 4 cups of frozen shredded hash browns in place of the boiled potatoes. I also added a teaspoon of seasoned salt to my flour before making the sauce and I added a little olive oil to the breadcrumbs. Otherwise I followed the recipe and it turned out great! Next time I am considering adding spinach or broccoli to make me feel like I’m eating something somewhat healthy! I served it with a fried egg on top.
Super easy to make!!! It was delicious!!! I did tweak it a little adding a spoonful of sour cream, chives and a dash of red pepper flakes. I would definitely make this dish again!
Just added garlic to taste..
I only used 1/2 a recipe and hubby loved it. It's on my regular menu.
Loved this recipie! An awesome way to use up ham and my fiance ate two huge plates! Will definitely make again

Delicious. I added 3 stalks ofcelery, chopped. Also, I mixed the butter in with potatoes while hot added the flour then milk. Put on top of ham, celery and onion. I cooked mine at a higher temp 400° 45 min

I was originally looking for a soup recipe to use up leftover ham but this recipe caught my eye and I had all ingredients on hand. We loved it! I'd say it actually tastes like a really thick soup. I made the recipe exactly as written except I left the skins on the potatoes. Delicious! Thank you for sharing.

I toasted the breadcrumbs before topping the casserole and shredded my own Cheddar. Was pretty good, I just didn't salt it enough because I was afraid I'd over salt it with the ham and cheese being salty already. Easy fix though.
Disappointed. This took much longer to prepare than the estimate and it was an epic fail. There was so much sauce that it was like cheese soup rather than a casserole.
Used green onion and a bit of hot sauce; adds colour and more flavour

It was really delicious... I did make a few changes. 

Instead of the potatoes I used a frozen bag of pre-cooked hashbrowns (which I recommend thawing in the fridge the day of making this recipe). I added about 12 cloves of smashed and minced garlic to the hashbrown and onion mixture. 

In the sauce I used 5 tablespoons of butter, and (accidentally) used 16 ounces of cheese (mozzarella instead of cheddar.) I wouldn't call it "sauce" as it had a much thicker consistency, and spread over the casserole more like a congealed frosting. We also couldn't wait for it to bubble and brown because oh, my lanta... when we tasted a bit off the spoon it was too good to wait for. 

Anyway. We really loved this recipe... one thing, though, if you use the bag of hashbrowns like I did is that I'd consider using both more ham and more onion. 

Oh! We also skipped the bread crumbs as we didn't have any on hand, and I don't think we suffered for it... but some french's fried onions and maybe some chives on top would have REALLY made this recipe POP.
We loved it!!!! Plan on making it again....
Easy, cheesy and delicious. Other than using Ritz crackers instead of breadcrumbs (I didn't have any), I made as written. Will make again.
This was amazing and I have to admit it was beyond my expectations. I would totally make this again.
Ultimate comfort dish. Do not need to wait for leftover ham but but buy ham slice. Made one change Panko instead of bread crumbs.
All seven of us loved it.
Used precut diced potatoes meant for homefries and precut diced ham on sale. Mexican blend shredded cheese in sauce.
So good!
Everyone liked it!
It is my favorite recipe of all time.
I added 2 cups of fresh sliced mushrooms.I also used about 3 cups total of milk as i found it to be too thick with just the 1.5 cups as stated in the recipe. really good!

Got this in the oven and it sure smells good. Bought a sugar spiral ham frozen from Cracker Barrel & baked it for Easter. I'm using the leftover sugar ham for this recipe. I used half the amount of cheese. Smells delicious

I made the recipe exactly as shown but used Panko crumbs for the topping. This was absolutely delicious. Exactly what I wanted for Easter dinner. I served it with hot rolls and steamed broccoli with easy to make hollandaise sauce.

Delicious comfort food. I added superfood coleslaw blend and peas to the ham, potato and onion mix. To the sauce, like many, I added spices - nutmeg, minced garlic and cayenne, and added an Italian cheese blend. Keeping this one for my apres snowboarders and snowshoers.
I rarely say this, but too much cheese. I was looking for a casserole recipe to use up leftover ham. I'll keep looking.
My family loves this casserole. I add diced up celery, carrots and mushrooms and use a large onion. Add thyme as well. Also sprinkle extra shredded cheddar on top before the bread crumbs.
I made no changes I just wanted to try it the way it is, I might do some changes on my next adventure though

Ok so I left off the bread crumbs because my family dont care for them but wow the dinner was amazing. Thank you. 
 Shauna
My family LOVED this meal. It was so easy to make and tasted great! I’ll be making it again.
We added fresh minced garlic and green pepper to ours. Had lots of flavor, also we used left over smoked ham from christmas.
I added some garlic to the onions and seasoned the potatoes with a host of seasonings including dano's original.
It was delicious. Thank you.
Made this. Hubby liked it. Didn't have enough cheese (only had 4 oz). Used a tad more milk and it was plenty cheezy enough for me. Will make again.

Loved it! Doubled the recipe because we had a lot of ham leftover from Christmas and there is only 2 of us. I melted some butter and mixed it with Ritz cracker crumbs to sprinkle on top instead of breadcrumbs.

Loved this recipe. Only change made was adding a little garlic powder, used a combo of ritz cracker crumbs mixed with Parmesan instead of regular bread crumbs, and to double the ingredients for the sauce since I had more potatoes and ham than necessary for the recipe. My family loved it, I loved it!! This will be a go-to recipe for left over holiday ham for sure!
The potatoes cooked much faster than the recipe said. Family loved this one! Would highly recommend!
Turned out awesome!!! My family loved it
I loved it and my 12 year old did to. I will be making this again.

This is the ham and potato casserole my mom made for years with leftover Easter and Christmas ham. The thing I do differently is to only sauté the onions in butter, make the cheese sauce, then mix it all together before putting in a buttered casserole. Continues to be a favorite 40 years later!
I just added some paprika and fresh garlic. Everyone ate it and asked for seconds
Really easy. Young teen boys could make this. Don't add salt to potato water if your leftover meat is a bit salty.

Very good. I filled 8 x 8 glass dish to top. I added the flour to the cooked onions and butter and continued from there. I didn't measure the milk, just added til good and melted the cheese. We like a lot of sauce so eye balled it. Two of us ate only half for dinner so more for lunch another day.
Very easy to make and very tasty. Will definitely be making it again.

Tastes delicious, using turkey ham. However, too much sauce so I had to add the steamed broccoli I had cooked as a side directly to the casserole to thicken a bit. The potatoes overcooked so the dish was mushy. I doubt I would make again just because of the texture.
I followed this recipe to a T. It was delicious. I wouldn’t change a thing. My entire family loved it and I am going to put it into the rotation. Thank you for such great recipes.
This was good, easy to make and tasty (we both had seconds). To the diced onion, I added celery and peppers and tossed in some leftover cooked carrots before baking. Would def make again!
. So wonderful. I will do this again as a side at Christmas.

This receipe is easy and delicious.
MY very 1st try at this combo.
I'm gluten free and cant do alot of dairy.
So I used cornflake crumbs, which made the best crunchy topping ever.
I also did not use any salt, as the ham has enough and my husband has high blood pressure.
We use lactose free milk and very old white cheddar which was perfect.
With fresh garden potatoes and onions it was a huge success.
Will definately do this again .
Next time though I'll use a longer lower casserole dish so I can make more crunchy topping .
Oh and when I poured the cheesy flour milk mix I used a spatula and made sure it oozed into the sides to get all in.
And grease all the way to the top if dish as it does stick otherwise.
ENJOY!

I used two medium potatoes and the casserole filled a 1½-qt casserole dish; 6 small ones would not have fitted. Also shredded my own cheddar (Tillamook X-sharp white). Good but needs something extra for more flavor - perhaps some minced garlic or rosemary.
This recipe is incredibly delicious! My family absolutely loved this recipe and it was great to use up the leftover ham. Very hearty, delicious and perfect for a cold day.
Awesome way to use leftover ham or a another way to eat bought ham. This recipe is delicious and filling. Shared with neighbors and they loved it too, even asked for the recipe

7-17-20. I went heavy on onion (1 large) and used Mexican blend for cheese (our preferences) and Panko breadcrumbs which did slightly brown. Baked 20 minutes on top shelf in oven, let set for 5 minutes before serving to allow sauce to thicken. Minor prep changes included letting potatoes simmer for only 15 minutes, removed from heat and then let sit in hot water to further cook and keep warm while continuing with the remainder of recipe. Layered 1/2 ham/potatoes mixture and 1/2 sauce. Repeated. Done to minimize having to mix in casserole dish. Great use of leftover ham!

It's like potato soup without the extra milk and in casserole form. It can drip in the oven so put a pan down at the bottom of the oven. Took a little longer with prep time but maybe I'm slow cutting potatoes, onions and ham. I used panko crumbs instead of regular bread crumbs. The casserole is delicious.
Delicious. Easy to follow recipe. Next time will add a little more cheese.
This was a delicious recipe! I only added some frozen mixed vegetables, to make it a complete meal! I used left over ham steak, I can’t wait to make it again!
So easy, so delicious and such a good way to use leftover ham. Great recipe.
Not to bad easy to make.
My husband and I just loved this. The only things I changed were throwing in a chopped green pepper and I couldn't use breadcrumbs because I didn't have any. It's so good.
Delicious! I was in a hurry so I used frozen diced potatoes with red & green peppers and onions. My family loved this dish! We will definitely be making this dish! Oops! This is all that was left.

Crazy easy and delicious recipe. I managed to lighten it considerably using less butter and cheese, and 1% milk---still very rich and flavorful! Go ahead and play with the ratios of ingredients... I was able to make a serving (a small/medium bowl) to contain only 385 calories and an awesome 30 grams protein! It's hard to go wrong with this recipe.

I made the recipe as listed with leftover Easter ham. It was a huge hit with my family. The ham tasted better as a leftover with this recipe than it did on Easter. Great flavor. Will definitely make again.
Good recipe. Will make again.
Wonderful recipe! Were not big one bread crumbs so I sprinkled a little parmesan cheese on the top before baking. Total comfort food bliss!
Used crushed fried onions instead of breadcrumbs. Otherwise, made as is. Delicious!
Turned out great! My husband and I went back for seconds. Nice way to use left over ham. Will definitely make this recipe again!
It was great. I didnt add anything except more pepper on top.
I added a little dried thyme. Yum!
This was good! I cooked with reds so I didn’t peel them. I had to use a 2.5 as it made a lot! Made extra sauce to cover it.
Made with my left over ham from Easter and turned out really well! Times very accurate to actually cooking times
